intro: Balkana, commonly known as the Balkan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in woodland or meadow habitats. Balkana has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
